qas.question: What did the Sumerians a complex system of around 4000 BC?
From the Sumerian metrology sprang forth the creation of what disciplines?
Where did the Sumerians put their multiplication tables?
When was the abacus first seen between?
What were the Sumerians the first to do when it came to mathematics?

answers.text: use a place value numeral system

qas.question: Who developed  a complex system of metrology in the 4th century BC?
What type of math did the Sumerians invent by the 26th century BC?
What tool was invented in the 27th century BC?

context: The <b5_0>Sumerians<b5_0/> developed a complex system of <a0_0>metrology<a0_0/> c. 4000 BC. This advanced metrology resulted in the creation of <a1_0>arithmetic, geometry, and algebra<a1_0/>. From c. 2600 BC onwards, the Sumerians wrote <b6_0>multiplication tables<b6_0/> <a2_0>on clay tablets<a2_0/> and dealt with geometrical exercises and division problems. The earliest traces of the Babylonian numerals also date back to this period. The period c. <a3_0>2700 – 2300 BC<a3_0/> saw the first appearance of the <b7_0>abacus<b7_0/>, and a table of successive columns which delimited the successive orders of magnitude of their sexagesimal number system. The Sumerians were the first to <a4_0>use a place value numeral system<a4_0/>. There is also anecdotal evidence the <b8_0>Sumerians<b8_0/> may have used a type of slide rule in astronomical calculations. They were the first to find the area of a triangle and the volume of a cube.
